titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. E. C. Lusk et al., Indictment
CWG6377

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
McCracken Circuit Court
Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
E. C. Lusk Jas Newberry Wm Wallace, W R Babb A. L. Banks & Jasper Babb

The Grand Jury of McCracken County in the name & by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse E C Lusk Jas Newberry Wm Wallace, W R Babb, A. L. Banks & Jasper Babb of the crime of Horse stealing committed as follows, Viz. The said Lusk Newberry Wallace Babb Banks & Babb did no the 14th day of April 1865 in the county aforesaid feloniously take and carry away one horse of the value of one hundred dollars the personal property of Franklin Harris -- The Grand Jury aforesaid charge that at the time and place aforesaid the said E. C. Lusk & A L Banks took and carried away one horse of the value of one hundred dollars the personal property of Franklin Harris & the said Jas Newberry Wm Wallace W R Babb & Jasper Babb were accessories before the fact by aiding abetting counselling & encouraging the said theft -- The Grand Jury aforesaid charge that at the time and place aforesaid the said Jas Newberry Wm Wallace & Jasper Babb feloniously took & carried away one horse of the value of one hundred dollars the personal property of Franklin Harris & the said E C Lusk. W. R Babb & A. L. Banks were acessories before the fact by counselling aiding abetting & encouraging & advising in the said theft -- all against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Witnesses
Wm Hull, Franklin Harris
Sterling Sheron Jacob Roark
Ed Moore of Graves Co

A Copy -- attest
B Small clk
By H. C. Yeiser D C
"Bail is fixed on this indictment at Five hundred dollars for each deft
"W R Babb ^has been^ discharged by order of court --

B Small Clk
By H C Yeiser D. C"

McCracken Cir Ct
Coml
v } Horse stealing
E. C. Lusk & others

A true bill
J G Cole
foreman
